result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick Jay Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol & no entry into any bars or taverns.
Must undergo Anger Management Counseling and follow through with any recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Erick Jay Erickson in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:02 PM. Called 15CM229 & 15CM230. Court has been handed PLQ. Lynch recites agreement. 15CM229 - Count 1 - DRI, Count 2 -  plea with a $300 fine plus costs. 15CM230 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 12 months with conditions:  costs, AODA and follow through, anger management, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT employment/schooling, 30 hours community service, State asks for no contact with MM. Lynch indicates condition of no contact will not be condition of probation. Count 2 - DRI. Erickson agrees. 15CM229 Court DRI Count 1, defendant pleads G to count 2. 15CM230 defendant pleads NC to count 1 and court DRI count 2. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his pleas, waiving his constitutional rights, court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. Lynch makes final argument and asks to follow joint recommendation. Erickson makes statement, remorseful. Proceed to sentencing. Court accepts joint recommendation. 15CM229 - Ct. 2 - $300 plus costs, payment plan of $50/month commencing 3/5/16 CO. 15CM230  - Count 1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 12 months with conditions: costs, AODA and follow through, anger management, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT employment/schooling, 30 hours community service. DNA with verbage, right to appeal.

Defendant Erick Jay Erickson in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:11 AM. Called 15CM229 & 15CM230. Lynch and Erickson have complaints, waives reading of both of them, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas and sets both matters for FPT. Lynch makes argument for bond on 15CM230 - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - reduces bond to $1000.00 signature with same conditions, refund bond to poster.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
